Steps.Description: Analyze the source code to identify potential vulnerabilities.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker suspects that the website is vulnerable to XSS attacks due to the presence of a Markdown converter that uses regex.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker examines the source code and identifies a specific regex replace function that catches their attention.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker discovers a regex replace function that transforms image tags in Markdown into HTML image tags.

Steps.Description: Exploit the XSS vulnerability by injecting malicious code into the alt attribute.

StepDetails.Hypothesis: The attacker aims to inject a double quote and break out of the alt tag in order to inject an event handler that triggers an XSS attack.
StepDetails.Action: The attacker constructs a malicious URL by injecting an onerror event handler into the alt attribute.
StepDetails.Result: The attacker successfully constructs the malicious URL that triggers an XSS attack.
